column1: #Text=-- Short Introduction what this repo is about -->

#Text=This repository contains a dataset, annotation framework and code for the work *"SciTweets - A Dataset and Annotation Framework for Detecting Scientific Online Discourse"* published at **CIKM2022**.

column1: #Text=You can also download the dataset and annotation framework from https://doi.org/10.7802/2434
#Text=-- *TODO*: refer to our work before being published (e.g arxiv preprint)
#Text=*TODO 2*: give examples of scientific online discourse here, e.g "The **SciTweets** dataset consists of ..." -->
#Text=This repository contains the following directories and files:
#Text=**classifier_preds** the classifier predictions used for evaluation in section 3 of the paper
#Text=**scibert_2stage_predictions.tsv** the classifier predictions to compute the prec@100 scores
#Text=**scibert_cv_predictions.tsv** the classifier predictions to compute precision, recall and F1
#Text=**heuristics** code and supplementary material for the heuristics explained in section 2
#Text=**cat1_sciknowledge.py** code to run heuristics for category 1.1
#Text=**cat2_sciurl.py** code to run heuristics for category 1.2
#Text=**cat3_research.py** code to run heuristics for category 1.3
#Text=**news_outlets_domains.csv** domains and subdomains from major news outlets
#Text=**repo_subdomains.csv** domains and subdomains from open access repositories
#Text=**sc_methods.txt** list of scientific methods from SAGE Social Science Thesaurus [Link](https://concepts.sagepub.com/vocabularies/social-science/en/page/?
#Text=**science_mags_domains.csv** domains and subdomains from science magazines
#Text=**wiki_sci_terms.txt** list of scientific terms extracted from wikipedia glossaries
#Text=**annotation_framework.pdf** the annotation framework provided to the annotators
#Text=**classifier_cv.py** code to reproduce the 10-fold cv results in section 3, table 3
#Text=**classifier_p100.py** code to reproduce the prec@100 results in section 3, table 4
#Text=**classifier_eval.ipynb** code to calculate the performance for section 3, table 3 and 4
#Text=**dataset_statistics.ipynb** code to calculate the dataset statistics for section 2, table 2
#Text=Label distribution of the annotated dataset in annotations/annotations.tsv:
#Text=More information about the categories available in **annotation_framework.pdf**

#Text=The SciBert baseline classifier trained in section 3 of the paper can be used for fine-tuning or inference following the instructions at [SciTweets_SciBert @ Huggingface](https://huggingface.co/sschellhammer/SciTweets_SciBert).
#Text=-- TODO: Update with correct information once we uploaded the paper somewhere -->
#Text=Please cite the following paper if you are using the dataset, annotation framework or pretrained classifier
#Text="SciTweets-A Dataset and Annotation Framework for Detecting Scientific Online Discourse."
